examples.description: Given a UK Limited Company which was started on 2012-01-01 -> And it starts using FreeAgent on 2012-01-01 -> And it has a contact in United Kingdom named Winston Churchill set to always charge VAT -> And the company's first accounting year ends on 2013-12-31 -> And the company is VAT registered from 2013-01-01 -> And the company has a pre-registration period of 0 months -> And the company is Cash accounting for VAT, not on the FRS -> And it switched to Invoice accounting for VAT, not on the FRS on 2015-07-01 -> And the VAT return covering 2019-09-30 has been filed -> And the company has the following invoices: -> And the company has the following expenses: -> And the company has the following bills: -> And the company has the following bank transactions: -> Given the current date is 2019-12-02 -> Then the expense Expense001 should have ledger entries -> Then the VAT return covering 2019-12-31 should have exact values -> And the VAT return covering 2019-12-31 will submit these boxes -> And the VAT return covering 2013-03-31 has been unfiled -> Then the expense Expense001 should have ledger entries -> And the VAT return covering 2015-06-30 should have exact values -> Then the VAT return covering 2015-06-30 will submit these boxes -> Then the VAT return covering 2015-09-30 should have exact values -> Then the VAT return covering 2015-09-30 will submit these boxes -> Then the VAT return covering 2016-03-31 should have exact values -> Then the VAT return covering 2016-03-31 will submit these boxes
examples.full_description: Sales Tax Updates - 4 year deferral (switching from cash accounting to invoice accounting schemes) Ledger entry for expense 001 are correct Given a UK Limited Company which was started on 2012-01-01 -> And it starts using FreeAgent on 2012-01-01 -> And it has a contact in United Kingdom named Winston Churchill set to always charge VAT -> And the company's first accounting year ends on 2013-12-31 -> And the company is VAT registered from 2013-01-01 -> And the company has a pre-registration period of 0 months -> And the company is Cash accounting for VAT, not on the FRS -> And it switched to Invoice accounting for VAT, not on the FRS on 2015-07-01 -> And the VAT return covering 2019-09-30 has been filed -> And the company has the following invoices: -> And the company has the following expenses: -> And the company has the following bills: -> And the company has the following bank transactions: -> Given the current date is 2019-12-02 -> Then the expense Expense001 should have ledger entries -> Then the VAT return covering 2019-12-31 should have exact values -> And the VAT return covering 2019-12-31 will submit these boxes -> And the VAT return covering 2013-03-31 has been unfiled -> Then the expense Expense001 should have ledger entries -> And the VAT return covering 2015-06-30 should have exact values -> Then the VAT return covering 2015-06-30 will submit these boxes -> Then the VAT return covering 2015-09-30 should have exact values -> Then the VAT return covering 2015-09-30 will submit these boxes -> Then the VAT return covering 2016-03-31 should have exact values -> Then the VAT return covering 2016-03-31 will submit these boxes
